definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]

sentences.english: He'll never fade, like the daytime mirages.
sentences.chinese: 他决不会像白昼的海市蜃楼一样逐渐消逝。

sentences.english: This course of action is advisable.
sentences.chinese: 这当然是一厢情愿的海市蜃楼。

sentences.english: They never reach the ground, evaporating like a mirage while still in the air.
sentences.chinese: 雨滴不曾落到地面，在空中就如海市蜃楼般蒸发。

sentences.english: Happiness is not far away like a mirage, that is not expected.
sentences.chinese: 幸福，并非遥远得如海市蜃楼，可望不可即。

sentences.english: There is a certain mirage-like quality to such operations.
sentences.chinese: 这些运营有点儿像海市蜃楼。

sentences.english: Perhaps oneself is a kind of to lure, The image of markets and buildings in mirage is just.
sentences.chinese: 也许本身就是一种诱惑，海市蜃楼而已。

sentences.english: There was the mirage of a distant country and wondrous scenes looming up in her mind.
sentences.chinese: 浮现在她心中的只有远地的海市蜃楼和奇异景物。

sentences.english: It is in bank managers’ interest to make mirages look like miracles.
sentences.chinese: 让海市蜃楼看起来更像是奇迹，符合银行经理的利益。

sentences.english: A mirage in the desert is deceptive.
sentences.chinese: 沙漠中的海市蜃楼是一种假象。

sentences.english: He thinks the boom is a mirage.
sentences.chinese: 他认为这种繁荣的海市蜃楼。

sentences.english: "The Curse of the Mogul" argues that this upside was a mirage.
sentences.chinese: 《巨头的诅咒》一书却认为，这些利好只是海市蜃楼。

sentences.english: It is in bank managers' interest to make mirages look like miracles.
sentences.chinese: 让海市蜃楼看起来更像是奇迹，符合银行经理的利益。

sentences.english: It hovered before his eyes like the mirage of an oasis .
sentences.chinese: 它在他眼前晃动，好像海市蜃楼里的绿洲。

sentences.english: We all have in our past a delightful garret.
sentences.chinese: 在过去的经验中我们每个人都有过海市蜃楼。

sentences.english: The water could not write a word can't afford to build house, only a mirage.
sentences.chinese: 水上写不出字也建不起屋，只有海市蜃楼。

definition: lit. flowers in a mirror and the moon reflected in the lake (idiom)/fig. an unrealistic rosy view/viewing things through rose-tinted spectacles/also written 水月鏡花|水月镜花
jeweled palace in the fairy mountain
variant of 飄渺|飘渺[piao1 miao3]
see 黃粱夢|黄粱梦[huang2 liang2 meng4]
